newsitem.title: JAPAN: Tokyo stocks seen drifting narrowly, lack direction.
newsitem.headline: Tokyo stocks seen drifting narrowly, lack direction.

text.p: Tokyo stocks are likely to drift narrowly in the Monday session, as investors hunt for clues to the market's direction, brokers said. They added that as Monday is the last day for July delivery, activity would be subdued with market participants reluctant to take fresh positions.
On Friday, the Nikkei 225 average closed up 103.31 points or 0.51 percent at 20,389.54. Turnover was a light 346 million shares. September Nikkei futures rose 90 to end at 20,420.
"The Nikkei average ended on an optimistic note on Friday and Wall Street was firm, so the mood is not bad," a broker at a "Big Four" brokerage said.
